channel.title: 金融时报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪金融时报news的种子

item.title: 在印度，印度教诉讼当事人正在向法院提出质疑，要求允许他们在清真寺做礼拜，而穆斯林认为此举侵犯了他们的权利
item.description:
In India, Hindu litigants are mounting court challenges to allow them to worship at mosques in moves Muslims see as intruding on their rights https://t.co/QMR2USIgtI

— Financial Times (@FT) March 18, 2024

item.title: 一项不乐观的预测突显了主导英国咨询市场的四大公司所面临的挑战。近几个月来，这些公司已经裁减了数百个职位，在某些情况下还冻结了薪酬。
item.description:
A downbeat forecast has underscored the challenges facing the Big Four firms that dominate the UK consulting market. They have in recent months cut hundreds of jobs and, in some cases, frozen pay. https://t.co/3Qv8PWBEsF pic.twitter.com/5ahTcYWPOs

— Financial Times (@FT) March 18, 2024

item.title: 为庆祝神经多样性周，我们很高兴与大家分享我们最新的 "伦敦金融时报生活 "博客，伦敦金融时报助理法律顾问杰-哈尔顿（Jae Halton）分享了他们作为神经变异者和 LGBTQ+ 的心路历程。访谈全文请点击此处：
item.description:
Celebrating Neurodiversity week we are excited to share our latest Life at FT blog, Jae Halton, Assistant Legal Counsel at FT London shares their journey as a neurodivergent & LGBTQ+ individual. Full interview here: https://t.co/QM9UfuvnM8

— Life at FT (@lifeatFT) March 18, 2024

item.title: 世界各地的女孩进入餐饮学校接受教育。相反，她们却被胁迫相信自己得到了上帝的召唤，要为 Opus Dei 做无偿家佣。
item.description:
Girls across the world joined catering schools to get an education. Instead, they were coerced into believing they had a calling from God to work as unpaid domestic servants for Opus Dei https://t.co/k1EwvkftDx pic.twitter.com/GhlnglwQcX

— Financial Times (@FT) March 18, 2024

item.title: 新 @FTMag：我对天主教会中一个强大组织 Opus Dei 的深入调查。然而，她们却被强迫相信，上帝召唤她们去做无报酬的佣人。
item.description:
NEW @FTMag: my deep dive into Opus Dei, a powerful group in the Catholic Church.

Girls across the world joined catering schools for an education. Instead, they were coerced into believing they had a calling from God to work as unpaid domestic servants.https://t.co/N1kNVvKeL6

— Antonia Cundy (@antoniacundy) March 16, 2024

item.title: 我们的 @FT 大阅读：印度寺庙运动的分裂政治。继阿约提亚之后，印度教诉讼人正在争取对另外两个印度教和穆斯林共有的圣地拥有更大的权利：Kashi Vishwanath/ Gyanvapi 和 Mathura/Shahi Igdah。@jyots43 #长篇阅读
item.description:
Our @FT Big Read on the divisive politics of #India’s temple movement. After Ayodhya, Hindu litigants are pushing for greater rights over two other shared Hindu-Muslim sites: Kashi Vishwanath/ Gyanvapi and Mathura/Shahi Igdah. With @jyots43 #longreads
https://t.co/KB8YJbE17d

— John Reed जॉन रीड (@JohnReedwrites) March 18, 2024
